edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse.Grid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class deals with all GameObjects on the 9x9 grid that the game takes place on. It helps GameEngine to move objects around and also re-populates itself after every turn. While GameEngine runs the game, the actual actions take place on the grid itself.
    Author:
    Ben Nickerson, Andrew Nipp, Andrew Niklas
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid()
        The constructor fills go with new GameObject, Makes a new Dice, Sets showBriefcase. Instantiates enemy with 6 Enemy Objects, shield by calling Shield.Shield(boolean), radar by calling Radar.Radar(boolean), extraAmmo by calling ExtraAmmo.ExtraAmmo(boolean), and fills gog with GameObjects.

    • Method Detail

      • setUpGrid

        public void setUpGrid()
        This method essentially populates the Grid for a new game. It calls setEnemy(), setPowerUps(), populateGrid(), and setBriefcase() in that order.

      • populateGrid

        public void populateGrid()
        Populates the grid with rooms in the position at go

      • printGrid

        public void printGrid()
        Prints out the Grid

      • changeAllObjectStates

        public void changeAllObjectStates(boolean toggle)
        This method will change all object states to visible/invisible depending on the value of the parameter. All it has to do is go through every square in gog and call GameObject.showName() or GameObject.hideName().
        Parameters:
        toggle - - boolean containing true/false. True when all objects are intended to be shown. False when all objects are intended to be hidden.

      • showObjectsWithinLocation

        public void showObjectsWithinLocation(int y1,
                                      int x1,
                                      int y2,
                                      int x2,
                                      boolean toggle)
        This method will show the objects in a specific location so long as the boolean parameter is true; otherwise it serves to hide the object at that specific location. Primarily used for the look function
        Parameters:
        y1 - - int containing the initial y coordinate
        x1 - - int containing the initial x coordinate
        y2 - - int containing the secondary y coordinate
        x2 - - int containing the secondary x coordinate
        toggle - - boolean when true will show the objects in that location, when false will hide them.

      • showPlayerDefaultVision

        public void showPlayerDefaultVision(int y1,
                                    int x1,
                                    boolean toggle)
        This method is used to make the Player's default visibility work. It will use the coordinates of the direction that the player is looking and call GameObject.showName() or GameObject.hideName() depending on whether the boolean parameter is true or false respectively.
        Parameters:
        y1 - - int containing the y coordinate of the direction the Player is looking}
        x1 - - int containing the x coordinate of the direction the Player is looking}
        toggle - - boolean when true will show the objects in that location, when false will hide them.

      • gridSize

        public int gridSize()
        used in testing only
        Returns:

      • rePopulateGrid

        public void rePopulateGrid(Player ply)
        This method will replace the [P] tile to the new position on the Grid as long as the Player is able to move to that location
        Parameters:
        ply - - Player Player

      • rePopulateGrid

        public void rePopulateGrid(int index)
        This method will repopulate the Grid with all of the Enemy objects. It is used for testing purposes only.
        Parameters:
        index -

      • changeObjectIntoBlank

        public void changeObjectIntoBlank(int posY,
                                  int posX)
        This method will cause the object at the given location to be replaced with a generic empty GameObject.
        Parameters:
        posY - - int containing the y coordinate of the object
        posX - - int containing the x coordinate of the object

      • getObjectAtLocation

        public GameObject getObjectAtLocation(int posY,
                                      int posX)
        This method will find an object at a specified location and pass that to whatever calls it. It does this by setting go to the location of gog
        Parameters:
        posY - - int containing the y coordinate of the object
        posX - - int containing the x coordinate of the object
        Returns:
        - GameObject go

      • checkIfLocationFree

        public boolean checkIfLocationFree(int posY,
                                   int posX)
        This method is responsible for checking if a location is free. If there is no GameObject at the location, it returns false; otherwise it returns true.
        Parameters:
        posY - - int containing the y coordinate of the object
        posX - - int containing the x coordinate of the object
        Returns:
        - boolean that is true is the location is taken, and false otherwise

      • checkForEnemy

        public boolean checkForEnemy(int yPos,
                             int xPos)
        This method will check for an Enemy in the specified location and return a boolean.
        Parameters:
        yPos - - int containing the y coordinate of the object
        xPos - - int containing the y coordinate of the object
        Returns:
        - boolean that is true when there is an Enemy and false otherwise

      • checkEnemiesStacked

        public boolean checkEnemiesStacked()
        This method will check to ensure that the Enemy objects are not stacked by comparing them.
        Returns:
        - boolean that is true when Enemy objects are in the same square and false otherwise.

      • setBriefcase

        public void setBriefcase()
        This method randomly places the briefcase by calling Dice.roll(). It then creates a temporary String[][] that stores the briefcase. Any time a Player enters a room, it checks to see if that room corresponds to the temporary room, holding the case. If so, the player wins and the game ends. AMN: Creates two local ints. Uses Dice.roll(int) to randomly choose 1, 4, or 7 (which are the rooms locations). Then it will create a new Room

      • getBCpos

        public int[] getBCpos()
        This method will give the location of the bomb as an int[] to whatever calls it
        Returns:
        - int[] briefcasePos

      • getBriefcaseRoom

        public Room getBriefcaseRoom()
        This method will give the Room object containing the bomb to whatever calls it
        Returns:
        - Room containing bomb

      • setEnemy

        public void setEnemy()
        This method randomly places 6 enemies on the Grid at least two squares away from the Player

      • getEnemy

        public java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> getEnemy()
        This method will return an ArrayList of Enemy objects to whatever calls it
        Returns:
        - ArrayList of Enemies

                      Player ply)

        Parameters:

        ply - - Player

      • checkForPlayer

        public void checkForPlayer(int yPos,
                           int xPos,
                           Player ply)
        This method is called whenever the Enemies move. It checks to see if a Player has a Shield activated before killing them for being within striking distance.
        Parameters:
        yPos - - int containing the y coordinate of the object
        xPos - - int containing the X coordinate of the object
        ply - - Player

      • shootGunCheck

        public void shootGunCheck(int yplr,
                          int xplr,
                          java.lang.String dir)
        This method will check to see if any Enemy objects are in the way of the bullet when the Player shoots
        Parameters:
        yplr - - int containing the y coordinate of the Player
        xplr - - int containing the x coordinate of the Player
        dir - - String containing a cardinal direction desiginating where the bullet will travel.

      • shootGunPrintResults

        private void shootGunPrintResults(int y,
                                  int x)
        prints results of whether there is an enemy at each position that the bullet travels over used for testing
        Parameters:
        y - - int containing the y coordinate
        x - - int containing the x coordinate

      • killenemy

        public boolean killenemy(int y,
                         int x,
                         boolean ran)
        This method will kill an Enemy when it is hit by a bullet
        Parameters:
        y - - int containing the y coordinate to be checked by the Enemy's
        x - - int containing the x coordinate to be checked by the Enemy's
        ran - - boolean that will runs the location check only if it is false
        Returns:
        - boolean that was passed in as a parameter
